module.name: geometrically_bounded_surface
module.purpose: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module to support the requirement to provide a description of geometric shapes by means of geometrically bounded surface models. It includes the geometric resources to define purely geometrically bounded models that consist of elementary and sculptured curves and surfaces.

inscope.li: Points defined in the parameter space of curves or surfaces;
Curves defined in the parameter space of surfaces;
The elementary curves line, circle, ellipse, parabola, and hyperbola;
Polylines that consist of at least three points;
The elementary surfaces plane, cylinder, cone, torus, and sphere;
Swept surfaces created by rotation or linear extrusion of a curve;
Replication of curves, surfaces, and surface models;

outscope.li: Geometry in a 2D cartesian coordinate space;

uof.name: Geometrically_Bounded_Surface
uof.description: The Geometrically_Bounded_Wireframe UoF specifies the definitional information for the concept of definition of surface models that consist of points, elementary or sculptured curves, and elementary or sculptured surfaces, by a consist set of geometric entities. Geometry shall be bounded; no topological entities are used for bounding.
